alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 6:24PM PDT until July 31 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy showers and thunderstorms occurring from the Victorville area points north. Street flooding has been reported at Bellflower street and Victor street in Victorville. Additional flooding is expected in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of around a half an inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Victorville, Hesperia, Apple Valley, I-15 Between Victorville And Barstow, northern Lucerne Valley, Adelanto, El Mirage, Phelan, Oro Grande, Helendale and Mountain View Acres. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
